author: norwayfish
content: If you want to do a message call and be 100% sure you're executing it on top of the expected head, you'd have to execute `BLOCKHASH 0` and compare in a new contract creation before doing a `CALL` from that contract's context, but then you're changing sender and can't call into all contracts that check sender != origin. Right now this can be avoided with flashbots, but that's delegating the trust to hold your txs from the mempool to builders ... Is there any plan to add a way to sign txs to be executed on top of specific chain heads to the execution clients? Or is there already a way that I'm not aware of?
